intro: Brachyactis indica, commonly known as the Indian shortleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and small, rounded leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern and eastern Asia, including regions of India, China, and Japan. Brachyactis indica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
